meta.title: Home - Laguna Beach School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow home-announcements fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_4 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

fieldset.legend: Play and Pause Buttons for Slideshow

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-36 fsTag-22 fsTag-26 fsTag-27 fsFeaturedPost

div.p: New student enrollment for the 2020-21 school year is now open and will now be completed online. Your child must be five-years-old on or before September 1, 2020, to enroll as a kindergarten student for the 2020-21 school year.

article.a: Read More about NEW STUDENT ENROLLMENT

div.p: In accordance with the most recent health measures in place to slow the spread of COVID-19, the May 7, 2020 Study Session has been canceled. You can visit our District webpage for updated guidance, communications, and FAQ on COVID-19 for additional information.

article.a: Read More about BOARD STUDY SESSION CANCELED

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-36 fsTag-22 fsTag-23 fsTag-25 fsTag-26 fsTag-27

div.p: LBUSD announced today the decision to extend distance learning until further notice, aligned with Governor Newsom’s expectation that school sites will not reopen this school year. LBUSD will continue to implement distance teaching and learning for the duration of the closure, consistent with the Governor’s expectation.

article.a: Read More about LBUSD EXTENDS DISTANCE LEARNING

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-36 fsTag-22 fsTag-23 fsTag-25 fsTag-26 fsTag-27

div.p: The Emergency School Board Meeting on Wednesday, April 1, 2020, at 9:30 a.m. will be held virtually and can be viewed at https://www.lbusd.org/liveboardmeeting. View the full agenda, including instructions for public comment.

article.a: Read More about SCHOOL BOARD MEETING

div.p: In the Laguna Beach Unified School District, each student gains the knowledge, experience, world perspectives, and skills needed to become a lifelong learner and producer in a competitive and interconnected world.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList home-news fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_5

div.p: Enrollment is now open for new students joining the Laguna Beach Unified School District for the 2020-21 academic year. The process has been adapted for online registration in order to comply with social distancing and the ongoing closure of the district's campuses and offices related to COVID-19 mitigation efforts.

article.a: Read More about NEW STUDENT ENROLLMENT

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-4 fsTag-8 fsTag-24

div.p: LBUSD announced today the decision to extend distance learning until further notice, aligned with Governor Newsom’s expectation that school sites will not reopen this school year. LBUSD will continue to implement distance teaching and learning for the duration of the closure, consistent with the Governor’s expectation.

article.a: Read More about LBUSD EXTENDS DISTANCE LEARNING

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-4 fsTag-8 fsTag-24

div.p: LBUSD, after careful deliberation and in an abundance of caution, announced today that it is closing its schools, effective Monday, March, 16, in an effort to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

article.a: Read More about LBUSD SCHOOLS CLOSED

div.p: LBHS Theatre invites audiences to a step into the enchanted world of Broadway’s modern classic, Disney’s “Beauty and the Beast, The Broadway Musical” at the Laguna Beach High School Artists Theatre beginning Friday, March 20 at 7 p.m.

article.a: Read More about BEAUTY AND THE BEAST

div.p: At the February 13 regular meeting of the LBUSD Board of Education, the board took action to approve the appointment of Dr. Julie Hatchel as Principal of Top of the World Elementary School effective April 20.

article.a: Read More about NEW TOW PRINCIPAL

div.p: Ranked School District in Orange County by Niche
Honor Roll Designation for Increasing AP Access
Social & Emotional Prevention and Intervention System
"No Place for Hate" designated schools by the ADL

img.alt: Laguna Beach Unified School District Logo

div.div: The Governing Board is committed to providing equal opportunity for all individuals in education. District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, including discrimination against an individual or group based on race, color, ancestry, nationality, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital, pregnancy, or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, or genetic information; a perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
